TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit List extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl implements class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer, class System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler, class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ITemplateable

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Renders a list of items as either a static display or an interactive list. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This control supports templated rendering by using device template sets and internal pagination. For more information, see [Device Filtering Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how an array binds and fills a List. Notice that you can programmatically set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataValueField%2A> properties of the List object.
[!code-vb[MobileListSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.mobileco_24_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[MobileListSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.mobileco_24_1.aspx)]

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Inheriting classes can override this method for custom data-binding behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string DataMember { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the data member to extract when data binding to a list data source. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The name of the data member to extract when data binding to a list data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is only used if the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataSource%2A> property is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, rather than of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object DataSource { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data source of the list that is being bound. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The data source of the list that is being bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To bind a data source to a list, you must first use the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBind%2A> method to ensure data binding. The data source can either be of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>, or it can be of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>. If the data source is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataMember%2A> field to specify which member to extract.

Docs.summary: Specifies which property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property. The default is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Specifies which property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> property. The default is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of decoration used for items. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An enumerated value representing the type of decoration used for items.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Where the target device permits, list items can be undecorated, or decorated with bullets or numbers. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration> enumeration has the following values:
|Name|Description| |----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration>|No decoration.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration>|List items are decorated with a bullet.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration>|List items are decorated with a number.|
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Decoration property to change the list to a numbered list. The property is set in the last line of the `Page_Load` method. This example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> overview.
[!code-vb[MobileListSample#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.mobileco_3_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[MobileListSample#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.mobileco_3_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Occurs when the user selects a command that is associated with a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you render a list by using templates, the ItemCommand event handler is called through the event-bubbling mechanism of ASP.NET. The event handler is passed an argument of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs>, which contains information about the source item and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> property of the control that generated the event. This allows you to render a single list item with multiple associated interactions.
On default rendering, the control provides a basic user interface (UI) that allows the user to click list items. On postback, the ItemCommand event handler is called with an argument of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs>, which contains information about the source item. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> property of this object is `null`.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the ItemCommand event to call a method that changes the status of an item in the list and recalculates the status totals. This example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> overview.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)] [!code-vb[MobileListSample#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.web.ui.mobileco_1_2.aspx)] [!code-cs[MobileListSample#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.web.ui.mobileco_1_2.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Occurs when an item in a is bound to data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> is created and data-bound, this event handler sets the properties of the list item from arbitrary expressions. An item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> is of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem>. This event is raised as each data source item is bound. This is the best time to filter or group items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> collection, by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> Property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the ItemDataBind event to get the starting totals of status settings for the list. This code is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> overview.
[!code-vb[MobileListSample#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.web.ui.mobileco_11_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[MobileListSample#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.web.ui.mobileco_11_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Returns the collection of items in a list. The default value is an empty collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The collection of items in the list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can add or remove items from a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> class.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the items in the list are to be treated as hyperlinks. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if items in the list are to be treated as hyperlinks; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value of this property is `true`, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataTextField%2A> property is used to display the text of the hyperlink, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataValueField%2A> property is used to specify the target URL. Command events will not be generated for these links. Thus, when the ItemsAsLinks property is set to `true`, an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.OnItemCommand%2A> method will not be called because a new page will be loaded through an HTTP call.
